user.title: Welcome to PI Thermostat
user.description:
This integration is installed with default settings.

Please configure the thermostat settings later by clicking the **gear icon** (configure button) on the integration card.

[Documentation]({docs_url})

data_description.climate_entity: Optional. When configured, can serve as source for current temperature, target temperature, heat/cool direction, and auto-disable.
data_description.operating_mode: Determines how the controller decides between heating and cooling.
data_description.auto_disable_on_hvac_off: When enabled and a climate entity is configured, output is set to 0% whenever the climate entity's HVAC mode is off.

data_description.temp_sensor: Optional if a climate entity is configured (falls back to the climate entity's current temperature).
data_description.target_temp_mode: Where to read the target temperature from.
data_description.target_temp_entity: Entity to read the target temperature from (only used when mode is 'External entity').

3.title: PI Thermostat - Step 3 of 3
3.description: Configure the **output entity**, **sensor fault**, and **startup** settings.

data_description.output_entity: Optional. Entity to write the PI controller output to (input_number or number entity).
data_description.sensor_fault_mode: Behavior when the temperature sensor becomes unavailable.
data_description.iterm_startup_mode: How the output is initialized when the integration starts.
data_description.iterm_startup_value: Output percentage to use on startup. Used as the initial value when mode is 'Fixed value', or as the fallback when mode is 'Last persisted' and no previous value exists.

error.no_temp_source: At least one temperature source is required: configure a temperature sensor or a climate entity.
error.heat_cool_requires_climate: The 'Heat + Cool' operating mode requires a climate entity to determine heating vs. cooling direction.
error.climate_target_requires_climate: The 'From climate entity' target temperature mode requires a climate entity.
